info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
At 414 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles west of Delaware, moving northeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible.
Locations impacted include... Dublin, Delaware, Marysville, Powell, Sunbury, Plain City, Ashley, New California, Radnor, Shawnee Hills, Ostrander, Magnetic Springs, Alum Creek State Park, Delaware State Park, Olive Green, US Route 33 at US Route 42, Warrensburg, Kilbourne, Interstate 71 at US Route 36/State Route 37, and Stratford.
This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 129 and 139.
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building.
Motorists should slow down and use extra caution.
When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens.
To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF DELAWARE AND EASTERN UNION COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 445 PM EDT
